3D614F79E80B4FCCA71E470733A88B38.description: reflects on, analyzes, and assesses strategies used while learning Michif.

61D6F2CD72A3408CBC745834386B828F.description: determines personal inquiry and learning goals; and,

1CA37315B20B4E8C972CFA8C21C7D1E7.description: reflects on new knowledge of Michif and its value to self and the wider community;

83CDDAE2B9684750B79C446057CCAB6B.description: determines personal inquiry and researches strengths and language goals;

10C6D2486550441F9C84D1540608FFD3.description: reviews, refines, through reflection, feedback and self-assessment;

BAA8F362700A4810AFFB407E0BBCFAB9.description: reflects on attainment of personal goals for effective language learning and use;

F51E7B55DEE345D6861A4DF4D709486A.description: assesses own and others' work for clarity, accuracy, and impact;

933550C5AD5340D69923F4656312A0ED.description: assess personal strengths and needs within the development of their own language learning as they relate to self, family and community and set goals for future improvement.

C4F0DC35A29645CCA6EAEEE2DBFDFE73.description: develops and uses criteria for evaluating self, goals, and projects.

ACC9D6E849334CF5B5911E353DC68B08.description: evaluates the quality of own contributions to group process and sets goals and plans for further development; and,

4ACE4B6272764D6AA8C578F0EF2D3CA5.description: recognizes speaking, listening and viewing as useful tools to clarify thinking, communicating and learning;

A1BB5A3B7C5B462D9A23899AFFA995D6.description: reflects on and identifies through the Michif world-view and language;

89FD54C1D3F64151B5C07D5B9B792123.description: assess personal strengths and needs within the development of their own language skill, and set goals for future improvement.

FAC301D5B8A044A09597B984CD55D43D.description: reflects on who they might approach to learn more about the Michif language.

63B5058B250F42D683EDA7560D01F1A5.description: reflects on what they might do on their own to learn more as a result of previous learnings; and,

0D453ED52B7942A9BC8A1C038BC12CF9.description: reflects on what they would like to learn more about;

5601638F38404672B0BED0754D91F70E.description: identifies with guidance what proficient Michif speakers do;

CEAF52D434544C45B97B4B6806DE0F59.description: assess personal strengths and needs as a Michif speaker and contributions made to the community of learners.

0B883DF132D54822B2B1B5E14D03FAA6.description: retells a traditional moral narrative orally with a focus on developing the main character; e.g., his/her strengths and weaknesses, his/her dilemma, the problem, the resolution, the lesson.

A630AD41A5C14118BEF05BFD828B6956.description: gives advice; e.g., write a letter of advice to themselves, to a younger brother, to a cousin; and,

BE04336633784104B9AE45696D35C963.description: perform language functions that allow them to produce discourse.

7D7128E67DF24878A73ECB88EF236B2A.description: explores effective forms for recording and presenting or using research findings, such as incorporating technology, visual presentation, a magazine article, or written report.

C8B3A02D87C44C2B9FB3F2532BAED0C1.description: follows protocol for acknowledging sources; and,

A539D038B34945F79422F09A3A90BC13.description: prepares a report or presentation (written, visual, using technology);

3245DFF69C9F48F38332B0C24257616E.description: organizes information in ways to fit the need or purpose of task;

953EA47623B64590ADF056C4E5CAE4E1.description: practices and approaches cultural resource people with appropriate protocol for collecting information;

885E8B888370440BAFEEBAE9809F2766.description: identifies possible sources of information, including people, written texts and media texts;

CDD4CC77B52F4DFE9A38004B11423725.description: consults with community Elders, and identifies a research need or purpose to gather information on the Michif culture;

29DCD3E6B1734AA4BCDA0FEFEB8B4F33.description: perform language functions that allow them to research.

555C36553C5F40B79E09A72B1144CD20.description: after hearing/viewing/reading discourse: demonstrates comprehension of main idea and details; demonstrates recognition of language techniques used for effectiveness of presentation; identifies examples of implied or indirect language; and examines purpose, such as hedging and avoidance; identifies the form of discourse chosen to match the purpose and audience, such as an interview, music, etc.; identifies the dilemma or conflicts and resolution faced by the main character in moral stories; reflects on personal lessons learned from moral stories; and, identifies examples of puns and jokes; and examines their construct and purpose, such as gentle criticism, audience involvement. etc.

B07DA9C3DAC94077A3DC0730121F27DD.description: engages in previewing or hearing activities that orient students to the discourse, such as providing background knowledge, recalling what is already known;

57AE62E697E14BA7BA3CB9008F476819.description: perform language functions that allow them to interpret discourse

C32E08D71DAD457296743BC70FDD5E34.description: demonstrates and explains an understanding of special symbols and objects used during celebrations and ceremonies, including their meaning and foundation in traditional narratives.

DF7EA3E9F2094D09853A05DAB9A47544.description: uses appropriate register at community events, such as introducing a speaker;

7C01CF6D11634F3C93EEFD6FC810ECC7.description: carries on a simple conversation with another speaker, and uses appropriate register;

E6C4EAEE8AE3448DB2162652C35A89F5.description: appreciates the spontaneous humour in social situations;

3745C60D2942434CADD0D32DE34D9D2D.description: perform language functions that allow them to socialize and celebrate.

44043B19CB5B455FB2A840EC4EDB323E.description: asks and answers questions using complete sentences.

C2C616E6580341D08B3964DC524DE6A3.description: exchanges ideas and thoughts on topics of personal interest; and,

239894B222F34C378E1ED9D5BA90BD2E.description: seeks, in discussions and group work, the input of those who are experienced in the area of discussion;

3C69FA90EDD7441CA4BF487A2E18EE16.description: attempts to reformulate the ideas of others in discussions and group work to enable consensus;

EC3CB67137AB421CB4C42D8156D53878.description: listens actively to others, in discussions and group work, and solicits and offers ideas;

78E87B6A8A674C23B834CB8DA3278A7D.description: exchanges information and opinions about moral dilemmas and issues affecting them personally;

FBB5FA59B5174965944FC6A39925AF3A.description: perform language functions that allow them to get and give information.

6BA3A1EA2601496EAA58D4172654E2D1.description: uses a wide range of interaction patterns to deal with routine and non-routine transactions and interactions.

504AAC5C5835434693EE6F2B82501B65.description: uses the appropriate level of formality with people in a variety of contexts; and,

29BD02C10A434AC98F14BA1825B4321B.description: adjusts language to suit audience and purpose;

CE405D00180A4B129F060FFA50BD7B0C.description: uses sentences and questions that contain learned vocabulary and familiar language structures in different forms;

0B9384CC5E6F47CA9EFF750B6B3A7CD7.description: uses linking devices throughout the discourse, though not with complete agreement;

46D25DF5B83741C5B59108781D209CB9.description: uses complex and compound sentences to hold ideas in discourse together;

FF0F70A44BD74A6AA7E4EFBC7C4BC246.description: communicate meaningfully with coherency (coherency relates to the connectedness of information, thoughts and ideas within communication)

9D10993295344503ABB2D1819A9B3043.description: sustains conversations for up to 15 minutes.

EDB09402055C4B489D86268EE8F2F012.description: listens to and reiterates what another speaker has said, though the listener may need passage repeated or explained; and,

98F2E45500A948C793AD8C2474BF3089.description: communicates thoughts, ideas, and feelings for specific purposes and audiences through a variety of verbal and visual media;

F16AF61B1C1D4C9E945451C7061FF73D.description: produces several sentences of spoken, coherent discourse, with relative detail and precision, in spontaneous situations;

AD575438A27C40EE97B0D75A0F85EA8F.description: communicate meaningfully with proficiency (proficiency involves the ease with which communication is expressed or received).

329C16A102EB44ECAE939E9D4CB2A1FD.description: reads factual texts or concrete information from a cultural study or prose that is relatively straight forward.

DBAA6FFFF21145B585FC46B886F62BD1.description: uses understanding of the varying sound systems of different dialects to understand them better; and,

C956CDBE2A874C7B96FBE18353BEDC51.description: uses complex sentences and phrases but not without error;

C35444BC22254CD2AF4A8E3582F5D2F8.description: creates a variety of basic sentences using accurate grammar;

083113BD6F934517ADFA2FDD53F2C3D4.description: communicate meaningfully with accuracy (accuracy is primarily the grammatical system of a language).

46198807A5954D0989476696E2319E42.description: seeks help from Elders in Michif language and cultural learning.

FB671E9CAB61433C8F5CFFC902FC6337.description: uses a buddy system in learning Michif; and,

DF03286F9C55461098585A700B441D02.description: provides personal motivation for learning by rewarding self when successful;

AE7C314BE31247498282DC9CCD1853F2.description: monitors own anxiety about learning tasks, and takes measures to lower it if necessary;

B3FF0FE6DA524D2A82D5A8ABED53923D.description: asks follow-up questions to check for understanding;

15134705AA20453A9ECCD23D16D1788E.description: uses various strategies to resume and sustain conversation;

94EF2982238849979112E210F4942C4A.description: uses social interaction skills to enhance group learning tasks;

227E21E3676142359808DFFC228107C5.description: works with others to solve problems;

DC5B48CC2FBC4AB5A268FC347F7E161F.description: takes responsibility for planning, monitoring, and assessing own learning experiences;

FE75A53B7DED4FDEA315BC8CEEF62588.description: reflects upon own thinking and learning processes;

F49306193BFC4A74A68A1BB24FDFF68D.description: demonstrates awareness of own strengths and areas of improvement in Michif;

E816C56592B643DFAD9C0B12350307D4.description: identifies own language learning needs and goals and organize strategies and procedures accordingly;

DC8DF9C376B245508935966631728E2F.description: uses previously acquired knowledge or skills to assist witha new learning task;

D51BE5DF28714C3089B82B0ED409C21A.description: seeks information through a network of sources including libraries, the World Wide Web, individuals, and agencies;

C12D03E9593945B1B4217D39C081904E.description: uses reference materials or a speaker to verify or help in difficult areas of language;

82B5BBCF8BD64236916A527407FFFDDA.description: seeks authentic language documents for research purposes;

172421C2B0C4407F8B7A570FBCED8B58.description: selects the best form in which to express intent in a given context;

95FA761F7D654D4B87EDF7E451F6724A.description: infers meaning, and then verifies by reading or asking questions when opportunities arise;

A54A45A56959487ABBD9322BD7E5764C.description: uses context clues to infer probable meanings of unfamiliar words;

93D2EB687BC147B186AA1D0E1369B4D6.description: seeks opportunities outside class to practice and observe Michif;

0FBA69CA44994CB4B3A8FF6BBE44E67C.description: seeks information through a network of sources (e.g., libraries, internet, others, agencies);

59B611991007472A810DF745F3783685.description: records unknown words and expressions, noting their context and function;

78B47D4D93274CF89A6D25E17A6E6857.description: select and use appropriate strategies to maximize learning and communication. Indicators for this outcome

5407356B464F4A988E5AFE6349FBB7F8.description: writes a narrative or other creative text; and accompanies it with a visual, kinesthetic or oral presentation that adds to its effectiveness for a particular audience.

BE2C3DCB9AF4470BB0D2F7B97E466154.description: writes a factual report based on researched information; and accompanies the written report with a visual presentation that adds to its effectiveness for a particular audience, such as graphics, display, computer interactive program, video program; and,

C6647D788EBF4E1CA87431DF1A7F22B9.description: researches and reports historical information relating to current issues, such as residential schooling as it relates to present problems;

9A971D9F816C4000BD62FC5D79F3FD54.description: shares personal reflections created such as a speech or a written text, in response to personal experiences or areas of cultural study;

66B4A19CC28B4201888B8755653E5F36.description: retells oral narratives or shares own writing orally and in written form, with the aid of various mediums, such as dramatization, art, or displays;

8D388FA62C50432AA1FA697146775256.description: produce language that is understandable to others.

45972247F5A54A19B5A5726ED80618AE.description: produce language that is understandable to others.

EA05B51CE350448B98098FB8DC064B5E.description: translates text between a Michif language and another language.

CAB7E584BD78471AB3220A2BB6139BDF.description: reads and interprets informational text that may be unfamiliar but relevant to research needs of the student; and,

8FCDD03F6B284E96ACDFD58704BF96DC.description: reads and interprets text that has been transcribed from the oral tradition of Michif people on a topic that is familiar to the student (contemporary lifestyles, fishing, hunting);

0A0171A64D2B4B7EA5F6097B930AECEA.description: interprets contemporary reflections in various mediums that relate to cultural areas of study, such as documentaries on social problems in the community, theatre, magazine articles;

BF325FB5CEC140148A5BB3651D748FA5.description: interprets and produces speeches with a variety of purposes, such as inspirational, political, tributes and guidance, with the help of Elders or other adults in the community;

2D72A00CD428490596B9D20AF18AE988.description: interprets and explains or invites a speaker to share traditional narratives of the people: histories, moral stories, songs, informational texts, inspirational speeches;

5E3C76EB6A3441C59E096FFE54D92E55.description: interprets and explains the proceedings of meetings regarding topics relevant to cultural areas of study, such as land claims, or community meetings;

C03E29912E5C4A37B78D6C1AB9047C31.description: understand and interpret language as a connected set of ideas expressed in sentences.

70F38DB1733E409DB9E95967B3A73BD7.description: interacts with a mentor on a project relating to the language and/or Michif world-view.

4240ADD7AFCD4044AC703E7D98B194E2.description: interacts with members of the community in acts of service to the community, such as volunteering at Elders homes or with long term care; and,

C0CAEA6E515A4275A6E9A4F865F8F09F.description: interacts with members of the community while participating in community events, such as wakes, Elder's gatherings, meetings, and language festivals;

AA648974A0A64D029488FCC5AE9626A6.description: interacts with members of the community and Elders while participating in nature camps;

B7852BAB1BF648CF9186269A79D2DED5.description: interacts with Elders or cultural resource people while researching or inquiring about cultural information;

5FC9976D054249C28C6DA3392E987100.description: interacts with classmates or school personnel in decisionmaking meetings, such as student council, class meeting, group project;

8A75184A2DD445EB8C66B9CDBED36FE1.description: discusses and promotes positive interactions and relationships in the school;

A77445AC0B244BB0AAA3036E70CC6E9E.description: interacts with classmates, school staff and visitors;

43A6E241CBF5448480456942C9E3543F.description: participates actively in developing language and cultural skills during experiential learning opportunities, such as helping at community/cultural events, volunteering with day-care children, visiting and conversing with Elders in the community, planning cultural camps/activities;

84EF1D2E63CF432DBF6DD19CA0F3090A.description: seeks information to further understanding of Michif concepts from Elders and other knowledge keepers within the community;

C5C514562F4B49888BB407F77714B362.description: interacts with classmates in pairs or small groups to complete class projects in the Michif language;

58F1CF8C69354F778910AC1526690216.description: interacts with classmates and teacher during language learning activities;

B8A6000C68A341C28B891662FA7C89D7.description: view, interact, and experience the natural and constructed environments of their community.
